title.label: Galaxy On Fire 2, The #1 RPG Of All Time

content.label: When I first downloaded this game on my very first iPad five years ago, my gaming life was changed forever. As soon as I got up in the morning, during the day, and before bed at night, I played this. I was young, but I got as far as the first Void space station. I had decent stuff, and a strategy that I used for Knights Of The Old Republic as well: Move around oddly and shoot randomly. I was young, so I didn’t even bother to strategize. My iPad broke a year later, and I got a new one two years later, on which I downloaded  this again, only to delete it because I was horrible at it. Now, on my new iPhone 8, I have downloaded it again, and in 1 day and 40 minutes (I got on today at 8:40 AM, it’s 9:20 AM right now) I’ve developed a mining strategy (Only get Hyperanium, Sodil, and Gold), improved my skills a ton, killed a pirate in a Dark Angel by using a Scram Cannon and Ex Charged Pulse Laser on the cheapest ship in the first Terran base (Starship), got a powerful shield and good armor, and currently have like 5 achievements. Overall, great game, best one out there for mobile, it has an amazing story and great graphics, and it’s the only good mobile game out there that doesn’t shoot ads at you like a machine gun and is not P2W or P2P! All the purchases are just DLC, you can win extreme mode without them, and I mean it! These devs should be proud of themselves. They have no ads, no P2W or P2P, and the game is completely original and well made. Please make Alliances , Manticore, and the other GOF games available on the App Store, and available for iPhone 8. Please make them free, too! Thanks for reading this, thanks for making the game, and keep up the good work.

I love 2 and 3 but can you guys make Galaxy on fire 4 make it open world with muiltiplayer and trading stations and you can buy space stations and sell them please you guys can’t give up now it maybe a hit please please or work with eve online and second galaxy those creators to make a huge game guys I’m begging I would do it but I don’t have Money guys please

Bien que les graphiques ne sont pas de la meilleure qualité et que le jeu est uniquement en anglais, ce jeu est l’un de mes préférés. Tu peux le jouer quand tu veux, ou tu veux et comme tu veux. Libre a toi de suivre l’histoire ou de travailler comme cargo voir comme mercenaire.
Je le recommande a tous ceux qui aiment choisir leur destin.

Excellent value for your gaming dollar!

This can’t be said for 99.9 % of the commercial/micro transaction trash that still continue to spread like COVID.

Ever since I finished Freelancer - one of my very favorite games of all time - I have been looking for a space combat and trading game that would be as fun and engaging.  I think I have finally found it.  Only an hour or so into the game, but really loving it so far!!!

title.label: Dear fish labs and abyss engine

One of the best games out there!

title.label: Great game, but I want my DLC’s

content.label:
So, it’s a great game, no doubt about it. It’s addicting, it’s engaging, and it has just enough of a story that it’s worth playing through to the end. The graphics are top notch, the gameplay is pretty fantastic, and it just works as a casual game to pick up and fly to the next station to see if they’ve got the materials you need for your next blueprint. My only complaint is one that seems pretty common here: the IAP’s from the previous version don’t count on this one. I bought both DLC’s, because the game is excellent and so were they, but on the HD version it wants me to buy them again. I’m not sure how much control the devs had over this, but I wish they would at least put the old one back up, even as a free to play, just so we could play the DLC’s without having to buy them again. 

But, if you didn’t have the DLC’s before and have no intention of deleting this from your phone to make room for something else (I believe you’ll have to buy the DLC’s again in this case too), it’s definitely worth your time and money.

I still love this game and come back to relive the fun. Only problem is button placement I would want to adjust the size and placement. Also I would totally pay for a 3rd or at least another updated graphic version of this with all dlc included.
Is there going to be another update where the story continues???
Series deserves to be continued. I can’t find another game like it.

This game is absolutely flawless, it’s like my other Infinity Blade (Even tho they are 2 different genres) there is practically nothing wrong with this game and it would be the best if it ever went on console. This game is absolutely worth it, I’d pay a hundred bucks for it it’s that gd. Please do get if u like sci fi spacey stuff.

Three stars is to appreciate their work, four-five stars is great work and two star means disappointments. On what you may ask? Yes this game is an amazing work so why aren’t they renovating this game? There are many factors to this and we don’t know what may be going inside of their organization so we can’t be sure what happened to this game when they stop releasing new updates for this game. It’s sad.

I love this game so much and I kept trying to get microchips before I beat the game so I could go to the mido system but I finally did it after I beat the game and I spent so much time on the game and I was actually hoping to play GOF3 but I’m sad it was taken down but I’m just glad GOF2 is here still cause I’ve been having so much fun in it killing pirates and void and I’m glad and sad that Vossk commander sacrificed himself for the good of the universe but now we can go to the Void system and worry about 3 voids while we mine but if we have back up fighters we can stay safe a bit there but thanks for bringing us this game creators and please don’t bring this game down

I saw that they’re shutting down the servers for GoF 3. Please please please for the love of all that is holy, do NOT shut down GoF 2 too!! There is NOTHING ELSE like this game out there, nothing even close, and I get anxious thinking about the day I won’t be able to play. Long live GoF 2, hands down the greatest space game on mobile, EVER.

I would live to see new ships and maybe some more add ons because I love playing this game, I am super late in the game and I know that there are more ships on the PC version and I would love to see them on here as well. Thanks a lot

This is the single greatest phone game ever made. This is a close to The old school Freelancer as you can get, in terms of gameplay and fun. 

If you have not played it, do it now!

I would love to rate this five star and go on and on on how amazing this game is, but as you see from the title, there is a glitch that RUINS EVERYTHING!!! If your a developer, please listen. 
I was in the middle of the void mission where you send a probe, and one time I went up-side-down and got stuck that way. Then 
I froze in place and I was getting blasted to bits. I finally got right-side-up but I stayed frozen in place. I was at the part where I had to escape as well! This is a major glitch that must be fixed. To all developers, please fix this, otherwise this game is epic. The only reason why I gave this one star is because of this glitch and the rage afterwards. (I also became an enemy of one empire for seemingly no reason.) To all buyers this is the best game I have ever played and deserves its title as Num. 1 Sci-fi game ever, just keep note of this bug. If I find more glitches, I will make edits, if the glitch is fixed, I will raise my rating and remove this text. Thank you for listening/reading. :)

title.label: Best space themed mobile game I’ve played

content.label: Love this game put at least 200hr into, it has a fun story campaign to follow as well as enjoyable side missions like hunting down pirates and mining ore. there is a bit of grind to get the cooler ships but its worth it for the awesome weapon,shield,mining drill, and ship upgrades options as well as a fun and immersive story and galaxy to explore. you get 4 different alien-races in the galaxy which all have unique space stations and ships As well as fun rivalry  i don’t do a lot of reviews but this game definitely deserves 5 stars.

title.label: One of, if not the best mobile game I’ve ever played.

content.label: I began my journey though this game and its entirely years ago, and I still standby and say this game is incredible. A year or two back I built the best of everything in the game, so all I can do now is play missions from the bars. I wish there was a way i could restart the game but keep all my progress with my ship and weaponry. I still enjoy this game like the day i first played it, alls i wish is there was more stuff added to do. I am not a fan of GOF3 due to it not feeling similar to this game whatsoever.

I played this game non stop, unlocked every ship, did every quest and bounty! The only sad part is galaxy 3 is absolute garbage compared to this.. can we pretty please get a galaxy 4!! In the memory of 2?

This game is actually fun these days games are just a bunch of ads to make as mutch money as possible but this game is good for real the voices acting  is very good the game play is good too i love the amount of weapons or armor etc. that you can bye this game is good I recommend it 100%

title.label: Can be perfect with one update

content.label: I overall love the game, but it could be improved with one thing. MAKE THE HIDDEN SOLAR SYSTEMS EASIER TO GET!! I have scoured every space lounge 5 times, and there are still like 10 solar systems that I can't access. Please make them more available!
Galaxy on Fire 3 is a shameless money grab but this one is a keeper! A gem among smartphone games! Highly recommend

I have been playing this game since 2011 and it is by far the best science fiction game on the App Store. Before the HD version of the game came out, models in the game just did not look fantastic, and the Jump drive really needed a new cut scene. I’m glad this HD version is available, thanks for 4000+ hours of enjoyment, still working to get more hours on the HD version, 48 hours at the moment, if you want to know, this is all the stuff I have gotten on the new version in the 2 days I have been grinding: 2,036333$ (credits), a Dark Angle, 4 M6 A4 “Raccoons” which are absolutely incredibly, a Khador drive, Gunant’s Drill, Yin Co. Shadow Ninja, 6 Rhoda Blackholes, T’yol, Me’al, every blueprint and hidden solar system on the free campaign, AB-3 “Kingfisher”, Fluxed Matter Shield, Hiroto Ultrascan, Ketar Repair Bot, Hammerhead D2A2, EMP GL II, and Intelli Jet. Thank you for reading if you have, and I really hope Deep Silver Fish Lab introduce the game with more campaigns besides the free campaign, Valkrie, and Supernova. 

A5 Artificial - Player of GOF 2 since 2011 and counting.

I looove GALAXY ON FIRE 2 HD. GALAXY ON FIRE 2 HD is sooooooo great. If I died and could come back as an app, I’d want to come back as GALAXY ON FIRE 2 HD!!!!! ALL CAPS!!!!!
Love this game!!! Would definitely pay for additional scenarios. This is the best space-fighter game EVER!!! Awesome graphics, storyline, and gameplay! PLEASE UPDATE WITH MORE SCENARIOS!

I played this game 5 years ago. It’s still pretty dang fun. While it does have some irritating things about it (enemy ships go well out of the way to engage you above all other ships, stations don’t generate new missions, etc.), for mobile gaming, GOF2 is a stud.
This game reminds me of Elite, but on a mobile device.  It took me a while to get trading and equipping my ship down but it is a blast.

title.label: Best Game on the App Store

content.label:
Let me just start by saying that this game is unlike any other game for mobile. Gameplay is bug-less and butter smooth. The graphics could be a little better, but that is not as important as gameplay in my mind. There are endless customization options for your ship, and once you finish the story it is entirely open world and you can go wherever and do whatever. Not many games are like that. I really like the idea of having factions at war and if you attack a faction your reputation with them drops. 

All in all, this is a true gem of a game and I have no negative feedback. I always say nothing is perfect, but that was before I found this game!

I've been playing this off and on for the last 4 years and I finally got all the dlc which was worth it and I regret not doing it sooner, it adds so much awesome content and gameplay I definitely recommend it. There are some downsides though, it can be pretty buggy, sometimes the game freezes and you have to reload from last save which can be  aggravating, and sometimes you don't get paid for missions when you're supposed to and you have to reload that too. It makes me miss alliances so much, that was a really cool game and i would definitely spend money on it, please bring it back!
This game so far has been pretty fun, 10/10 would recommend.

Ok so I'm slow to roll and I've been playing and replaying this game for years now. I love it, and can't help myself. It's therapeutic and like an old friend, it's there whenever I want it, without question. The gameplay is straight forward, the graphics are superior and there are multiple layers of play from good guy to bad guys, to merc and more. Even after all this time I don't find myself bored, unlike with other games of this genre I've played since I purchased this one. My only whine is that there aren't any patches or game extensions to add to this game. If there were, I'd buy them and wear them out as well. Thanks guys for giving a well seasoned player a game to enjoy repeatedly.
Takes me off this pandemic mess!
Great story and gameplay.
More entertaining and much safer than listening to tRump lie to the working masses.

An idea for the Kaamo Station could be the ability to upgrade its technology level over time. Since Kaamo offers extra special ships and weapons a tech level of 10 might be appropriate. Also you should add an ability to change background music and station skins after the player purchased the station.

This game is definitely amazing. But the control system is not up to date with new phone sizes. Right now I’m using a iPhone 11. The screen layout of the game puts the control on the bottom left corner, which makes me hard to control the ship. I hope developers can add a floating control handle function to the game, it would be a lot easier for people with newer versions of phones to play this game.
